result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun Quantay Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: (STRAIGHT TIME), consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 9/28/16, cash bail to apply. Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.
Restitution is set at $0.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

timeConds.notes: (STRAIGHT TIME). This time is stayed to be used at the probation agent's discretion.
Successfully complete 20 hours of community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaun Quantay Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant sentenced to serve 180 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 50 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
          in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed to be
          used at the probation agent's discretion.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 9/28/16, cash bail to apply. 
          Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Successfully complete 20 hours of community
          service. 
     *   Restitution is set at $0.
     *   Letter of apology.
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights received and filed.

Defendant Shaun Quantay Taylor in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Shaun Quantay Taylor in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for final pre-trial. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings. Court unable to hear jury trial on September 28, 2015 as Court is down on September 30th through October 2nd. Defense counsel requests jury trial date converted to projected guilty plea and sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch  37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Defendant Shaun Quantay Taylor in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel requests jury trial date.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.    Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shaun Quantay Taylor in court pro-se.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. Defendant is now public defender eligible. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant contacted the Court to reschedule from 8:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. on June 1, 2015.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Shaun Q Taylor in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the Milwaukee, County of.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant needs additional time to retain counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Defendant Shaun Quantay Taylor in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/17/15 @ 1:30 pm
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 01/01/2015
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 01/01/2015
